attributes.action: Don't leave the EU
attributes.background: It would be a colossal mistake for the UK to leave the EU. The Government is floundering in the Brexit negotiations and the country would be poorer in every sense outside of the EU. And It would affect young people's lives greatly and this could become Regrexit.
attributes.additional_details: The referendum result should be disregarded as so many people who voted to leave were tricked by the lies of the Brexit camp. So much for democracy if people have been hoodwinked. We need to show the Government that this Brexit disaster is not "the will of the people" by calling on them in sufficient numbers to stop it. I don't think enough people realised quite how complicated it would be to leave the EU, so here's a better idea: Stay in. The EU would welcome us back with open arms.

attributes.action: UK Govt: Help to rebuild communities affected by the mudslides in Sierra Leone
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, recognise the immediate aid provided to Sierra Leone by the UK Government in the aftermath of the horrific mudslides. We ask the Government to continue to support Sierra Leone and to set out a long term strategy to help rebuild communities destroyed by the mudslides.

attributes.action: Mandatory for ALL eye tests to include Pupillary Distance (PD).
attributes.background: Without the Pupillary Distance (PD) it is impossible to create prescription glasses, get the distance wrong and depending on how inaccurate it is, can cause the following symptoms: blurry vision, double vision images, headaches, nausea, and fatigue.
attributes.additional_details:
- 69% of the UK population wear prescription glasses
- Online retailers can be 40% cheaper than high street opticians
- It is unfair that people on lower incomes are forced to buy cheap     glasses when they could afford fashionable frames and lens if they could buy from online retailers.
- Opticians don't provide PD today pointing to Statutory Instrument (1984 No. 1778). This was last reviewed in ’84 the internet was just for email then!! So this badly needs an update.

attributes.action: Make homework voluntary for children
attributes.background: Homework should be voluntary as children with a high homework load often suffer from mental health problems such as anxiety and depression. The homework given to a child should be limited and not compulsory to allow time to relax, enjoy physical activities and to sleep.

attributes.action: Make 'Up To' internet package speeds illegal.
attributes.background: 'Up To' internet speed packages plague the UK market and are used as an instant 'get out of jail free card' if the companies oversell or over promise on what customers are expecting. Customers are not able to accurately compare speeds and often receive much lower than is stated.
attributes.additional_details:
Internet packages are often sold as 'Up To' speeds. A package 'Up to 100MBps' may in fact regularly provide 8MBps (8% of the expected speed). The Government should either: 
A) Require the speed received to be no less than 80% of the speed advertised, (example "100MBps", min acceptable 80MBps) 
Or 
B) Force companies to sell at the minimal acceptable speed, (example "From 80MBps"). 
If the speed paid for is not met for more than 1 hour the customer should not have to pay for that days costs.

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: Proscribe Hezbollah as a terrorist organisation in its entirety in the UK
attributes.background: There is a legal loophole in the UK that allows the flag of Hezbollah, an organisation which hates the West, is anti-Semitic and perpetrates international acts of terror,to be flown in Britain because only Hezbollah’s military wing is proscribed by the Government but not its supposed political wing.
attributes.additional_details:
However, even Hezbollah’s own leadership does not differentiate between the two.  Speaking in October 2012, Hezbollah's Deputy Secretary General Naim Qassem stated: "We don't have a military wing and a political one; we don't have Hezbollah on one hand and the resistance party on the other."

This petition calls upon Home Secretary Amber Rudd to once and for all listen to Hezbollah themselves and proscribe Hezbollah as a terrorist organisation in its entirety in the UK.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of Nitrogen Dioxide exposure by expanding the UKs sensor network
attributes.background: Levels of Nitrogen Dioxide across the UK are constantly over WHO limits, causing detrimental damage to our health. Awareness of high pollution areas is still low as the monitoring set up covers very few locations so people cannot take informed decisions to reduce their exposure.
attributes.additional_details: Exposure to any amount of nitrogen dioxide impacts our health and  our children's health.  Despite this there is limited coverage of the exposure we face in our daily lives.  There are few monitors and no public information showing pollution across our transport network, in schools, offices and levels inside vehicles. We therefore call upon the government to increase awareness of NO2 exposure by funding additional sensors and research into hotspots so information is available to the public.

attributes.action: Create an official medal for emergency services involved in the London attacks.
attributes.background: Reward of a medal in recognition of the phenomenal service provided by London emergency services to all those involved in the summer 2017 London terrorist incidents, including emergency responders as well as investigation teams and counter terrorism officers.
attributes.additional_details: The London summer of 2017, has seen an unprecedented threat from terrorism, with attacks on Westminster Bridge, London Bridge & Borough Market, Finsbury Park, police officers close to Buckingham Palace and a London Underground train. The response of emergency services has been exceptional. This outstanding service to public/country has been publically recognised by the Prime Minster, the Mayor of London, and the Home secretary who rightly quantified that “there has been no summer like it”.

attributes.action: Ban Transfat in food production
attributes.background: The Partially Hydrogenated Oil family (PHO's) are a common food additive known to cause high Cholesterol, a condition which can cause stroke and heart attack. They have been banned from food production in several countries including America from 2018 and we are calling for a UK ban.
attributes.additional_details: PHO's are a Transfat. You will find them listed on the ingredients of most processed food including bread and pastry products under these names E471, E472, Mono and di-glycerides of fatty acids Hydrogenated or Partially Hydrogenated fats. The British Heart Foundation says: “Avoid wherever possible. They can increase cholesterol in your blood." Heart disease and stroke, to which high cholesterol contributes, are ranked in the top 5 most common killers only beaten to the number 1 spot by cancer.

attributes.action: Make any overtime worked over standard contracted hours Tax free
attributes.background: I, like most, work hard as my wife does too over 50 hours per week often working Mon-Fri and then Sat and some times Sunday to earn extra cash to give our family a better standard of life and we are then taxed on the extra hours even after our standard normal weekly wage has been deducted
attributes.additional_details: This would be a massive benefit to lots of parents and families and encourage more people to do a bit more and get rewarded and then help the economy by spending that little bit extra!

attributes.action: A life sentence should mean there can never be the chance of parole.
attributes.background: A life sentence should mean just that. There should be no chance of parole. The sentencing guidelines need to be changed so that life means life. Whole life tariffs for the most heinous crimes should be mandatory. Life should mean Life.

attributes.action: Provide blood glucose meters for all type 2 diabetics on the NHS
attributes.background: You can't control blood sugar levels without knowing what affects your blood sugar and it's too expensive to buy your own meter and strips as well.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for UK Councils to provide recycling bins in all public areas
attributes.background: Recycling is a small but pivotal source of reform to our behaviours that can have a big impact on reducing the effects of global warming. The Government should not only support but enforce measures to reduce our carbon footprint by making recycling points commonplace around UK high streets and parks

attributes.action: Britisher should have right to make/change laws through referendum like Swiss.
attributes.background: This is the real idea about real Democracy. Through this process Swiss State have provided rights for public and opportunity to have a say in decision making to change or to make new laws for Swiss nation.
attributes.additional_details:
In Switzerland general people can make new laws and could make constitutional amendments through a referendum . If anyone would like to make new law or would like to make any constitutional amendment in Switzerland ; he/she or group of people should get 100,000 signatures to support their proposal .

Please see Swiss Constitution.

attributes.action: UK Government to impose trade sanctions on Venezuela, over human rights abuses.
attributes.background: Democracy has been betrayed in Venezuela. With top opposition politicians like: Leopoldo Lopez and Antonio Ledezma, being unlawfully arrested. The severity of the political crisis has triggered mass protests for months. Protests resulting in: nearly 5000 arrests; 163 deaths; 15,000 injured.
attributes.additional_details: Why should the UK Government fund a tyrannical state? A state that ignores International Human Rights Agreements, that they even co-signed. A state where the detention of the opposition is natural. In 2015, Venezuela exported $286 million worth of goods to the UK - most of which was mineral products (99.2%). The UK exports to Venezuela in 2015 amounted a total of $318 million. Although Venezuela may be an attractive source of investment for UK firms, I urge them to stop. Simply because the trade revenue enables Pres Maduro's suppression of basic human rights. The UK should impose embargo on the nation until democracy has been restored.

attributes.action: Remove VAT on silver and platinum coins issued as legal tender.
attributes.background: The Royal Mint issues bullion and collectable coins in gold, silver and platinum. Gold is exempt from VAT but silver and platinum are not. There is no good reason for charging a value added sales tax on money at all. It is also inconsistent to have gold exempt.

attributes.action: Double the mandatory sentence for possession of a Firearm
attributes.background: The UK and specifically urban inner city areas are blighted by gun crime. Murders, injury shootings and possesssion of Firearms (Section One) are increasing. The mandatory sentence for possession of such a Firearm at the moment is 5 years.Doubling this to 10 years would provide a massive deterrent.

attributes.action: Stop speed-limited vehicles from overtaking during peak congestion periods
attributes.background: Speed-limited vehicles performing over-taking manoeuvres cause congestion on motorways and dual carriageways during peak periods. Such manoeuvres are slow in terms of time and distance and create bottle necks. Limiting these to outside of peak periods would ease congestion.

attributes.action: Every Knife sold through Retailers in the UK have tamper proof serial numbers.
attributes.background: Make our UK Streets safer for people and today's Youth. Every Retail purchase made by a person must produce ID , proof of address (much like a television for licensing purposes).This may significantly help police to save time and money and also to identify the perpetrator(s) leading to a conviction.
attributes.additional_details:
OBJECTIVE
-Licenced retail outlets allowed to sell knives and blades.
-Knives and blades to have concealed & tamper proof serial number.
-Registration of knives & blades via Metropolitan Police Website including Lost & Stolen.
-Photo ID, Proof of Address shown at point of sale. 
-CCTV installation means cases of identity fraud can be traced.
-Knives & Blades sold in sealed boxes - Not shelf sales.
-Ban on websites selling knives into the UK meaning a closed domestic market to Knife & Blade sales

attributes.action: Put a cap on the amount of hours an NHS employee can work in one shift.
attributes.background: NHS employees do life saving work. How can they successfully do their job whilst performing long shifts. There should be a cap appropriate so that they can continue to do their life saving work at a high level.

attributes.action: Arm the Rohingya who are facing ethnic cleansing in Myanmar
attributes.background:
The Rohingya are the most persecuted ethnic minority group on Earth. Their villages are burnt to the ground by Burmese soldiers. Abuses include rape, killing civilians and burning villages.
 
The Rohingya need access to weapons to defend themselves and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
The Burmese military has committed harrowing atrocities against the Rohingya and we need to act in the same way that the international community acted when ISIS committed atrocities against the Kurds and Yazidis.
 
The UK should provide military and logistic assistance including arming Rohingya villagers so that they can sufficiently protect themselves against the rapists and killers.

attributes.action: Make Emergency First Aid mandatory in schools
attributes.background: Unfortunately, far too many people wouldn't know what to do if they came across somebody in need of emergency treatment. From choking babies, bleeding or loss of consciousness, if people were given these skills while at school it would stay with them and could mean saving a life.
attributes.additional_details:
First Aid qualifications are valid for 3 years from the date of issue. 
If learning these vital skills while in school was mandatory, it could mean that one day your life could be saved by someone passing, simply because they had received the right training.

attributes.action: Dismiss Secretary of State Boris Johnson from the government.
attributes.background: Secretary of State is noteworthy for bringing UK into disrepute abroad and at home, his massive personal ambition, for his gaffes and for outrageous continuing promise of £350m a week for NHS if we leave EU. He is demanding an impossible form of Brexit that prevents a decent deal.

attributes.action: HGVs to be restricted to the slow lane only on motorways and dual carriageways
attributes.background: Due to the increase in serious road traffic accidents cause by HGVs we would like to see HGVs restricted to the slow lane on motorways and dual carriageways

attributes.action: Reduce Dartford crossing charges
attributes.background: Residents from Dartford and Thurrock  pay much reduced dart charge .  But people working on other side of the bridge pay a normal rate and even though you set yourself an online account - they still rip you off ! I spend ~£70 a month! Let's end this !

attributes.action: Change trespassing from a civil offence to a criminal offence.
attributes.background: More and more trespassing and trespassers are exempt from any direct police action. What follows are costly legal proceedings against trespassers to eventually evict and in some cases the trespassers return to start the whole eviction process again.
attributes.additional_details: http://dailym.ai/2h40DL0

attributes.action: Abolish Universal Credits before it puts majority of the UK in poverty
attributes.background:
The new Universal Credit replaces JSA, Income Support, ESA, Housing Benefit, Tax Credits and Working Tax Credits.

BILLIONS taken from the needy and most vulnerable in society.
attributes.additional_details:
Universal Credit is about cutting the Social Security bill meaning millions will be worse off. 
Once fully implemented Universal Credit will mean easier sanctioning forcing people to live off nothing. 
Housing subsidy will be time limited for some 18-21 year olds forcing more to be homeless. 
Support for child care drastically cut. 
Disability elements cut or abolished altogether. 
Thousands of small businesses will be forced out of business. 
Some rates are lower than current benefit rates.

attributes.action: Spend aid budget on NHS before all Non-Humanitarian Aid.
attributes.background: The NHS should benefit from funding of the Foreign Aid budget where expenditure is for Non-Humanitarian Aid. It is time front line staff are given decent a pay increase and nurses bursaries were reintroduced to encourage UK nationals to have a career in this field. More funding for mental health too

attributes.action: Move all voting days to weekends to avoid disruption in schools and industry.
attributes.background: The recent elections caused concern amongst a large number of parents,teachers and business owners.This was due to the disruption of schools being closed on a workday.Moving voting to a weekend would prevent this.

attributes.action: Introduce the British Empire as a mandatory part of the Key Stage 3 curriculum
attributes.background: Currently the British Empire is an optional and small footnote on the History syllabus. A thorough and balanced mandatory module should be introduced to proportionally reflect the impact the Empire has had on our diverse UK population, and its impact on public attitudes towards immigration and race.

attributes.action: Make a law to stop people parking cars on communal lawns and grass verges.
attributes.background: When cars are parked on communal lawn areas in housing estates it causes the lawn to become messy with tyre ruts and it also makes the area look unsightly.This causes the ground to become uneven causing a trip hazard to the public. It also blocks the view of other drivers on the road.

attributes.action: Stagger school holidays - stop holiday ripoffs
attributes.background: Companies massively increase the costs of holidays and days out during school holiday times in the UK.  By staggering the school holidays to spread demand, parents and those who work in education will be able to take advantage of cheaper prices.
attributes.additional_details:
Parent risk court fines in taking their children away in term-time to benefit from cheaper deals.

Time together as a family and learning about new cultures can be beneficial for children’s development and offers a valuable education alongside lessons taught in school

This petition calls for staggering school term dates by region, i.e. so if a parent has a child in a primary school and a secondary school in the same region, their holidays will be the same.

attributes.action: Make March 29th Brexit Bank Holiday
attributes.background: Celebrate our EU exit

attributes.action: Rid the TV licence fee for all students living away from home
attributes.background: Although often living on money provided by government or guardians, students in the UK are still expected to pay for their television licence. Many students already find it difficult to budget their living costs without this extra outgoing.
attributes.additional_details:
An article from The Telegraph states that, due to a recent change in the law, 'Magistrates will also be permitted to apply their discretion in situations where the defendant had been experiencing "significant financial hardship" at the time due to "exceptional circumstances".'

Students are often in some sort of financial hardship and are refused the luxury of watching television whilst in uni merely because they cannot afford this.

attributes.action: To make the wearing of a cycle helmet compulsory when cycling on public roads.
attributes.background: The increase and popularity of cycling has exploded over the past few years and brought thousands of cyclists onto our crowded roads and into conflict with other road users. The potential for accidents has increased and the potential for fatal head injuries.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015, 18,844 cyclists were injured in reported road accidents, including 3,339 who were killed or seriously injured. (Source ROSPA)

attributes.action: Install security checkpoints at every underground transport station in the U.K.
attributes.background: Given the increasing prevalence of terror attacks in major U.K. cities, discuss reforms of national transport security policy. Initially install baggage scanners and metal detectors at underground stations and conduct random searches (not based on profile) of passengers crossing station checkpoints.
attributes.additional_details: Global cities more densely populated than London require passengers to place large items on scanners before proceeding to trains and metros. Metal detectors are also used to detect weapons and explosives. It is currently too easy to bring dangerous articles into confined stations in the U.K. wherein likelihood of injury and fatality from terror incidents increases. Requiring random searches of passengers and staff entering these stations could also mitigate the possibility of unfair profiling.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to spit in the street/road. You should be fined if you do so.
attributes.background: So I have seen a lot of people spit in public on the road or pavement. It is honestly disgusting. They should be fined. Countless times I've seen this, especially in the Hayes area. You should be fined if you are caught by doing this. This rule should everywhere.
attributes.additional_details:
Places like have banned this: Enfield, Central London, Waltham Forest Council.

Sources:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-25291274
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2430724/Fined-160-spitting-street-First-prosecutions-councils-tough-littering-laws.html
https://www.standard.co.uk/news/london/people-who-spit-in-the-street-in-london-face-80-fine-9912228.html

attributes.action: Stop Kim Jong Un from ever coming to the UK.
attributes.background: Kim Jong Un is becoming increasingly powerful and reckless, we can't allow a man like that in our country.

attributes.action: Outlaw the sale of new build properties as buy-to-let "investments"
attributes.background:
Too many new-build properties are sold as buy-to-let "investments", often at first refusal before they are even complete.  This restricts supply, keeps prices inflated, and usually keeps young people off the property ladder and in the trap of high private rents.

This should be outlawed.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK is facing an unprecedented housing crisis in terms of supply, cost, and the extremely high private rents.  Young people are trapped for YEARS as tenants, or living with parents, because there are precious few affordable homes in many places.

There are whole new-build housing estates and blocks of flats which are sold off in advance (often before the property is even built) and become 100% BTL empires from the very first day, not available for people to actually buy for themselves.

attributes.action: Refuse RSPCA entering homes/property to seize animals without permission/police.
attributes.background:
The RSPCA is seeking new powers in England and Wales to search some private property, including sheds and gardens, without a police warrant.
It also wants inspectors who have been invited to enter a home to be able to "seize animals in distress" without awaiting a police presence.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-40542246

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/rspca-government-powers-private-property-remove-pets-defra-england-wales-a7830176.html

attributes.action: Make the motor trade require a licence to be a mechanic
attributes.background: The motor trade unlike all other trades doesn't require a licence for the tradesmen and women to work. Garages can employ anybody as a mechanic. Unlike plumbers for example who need licences to work. A licence would ensure mechanics are capable of doing the job to a reasonable standard and safely.

attributes.action: Introduce an emergency alert text system nationally
attributes.background: The UK is now on the highest terrorist threat level, yet again. I personally believe it is unacceptable that our general public are not notified of horrific events that happen, endangering our safety. I believe a system should be introduced, like in the USA, alerting the public via text.
attributes.additional_details: It could also be used to alert the public of missing people, etc. I feel unsafe walking in city areas so close to people knowing the horrific events that happened recently. If people were to be alerted, it'd give them a better chance of evacuating the area. Theresa May says an attack is imminent, we CANNOT wait until another attack happens to take action. The system in the US uses phone masts to alert everyone who's connected in the area. The President can alert the whole country at once too.

attributes.action: Change the GCSE English Literature exam from closed book to open book.
attributes.background: Last year, lots of students struggled with GCSE English Literature as it was a closed book exam. Because of this many failed. How can they expect us to remember quotes from 15 poems, plus how to analyse them, plus remembering the whole plot, themes, characters and quotes from another book.
attributes.additional_details: Is it really fair that students have to remember so much, whilst also doing revision for other exams. It is important to know how to do all that is asked in the exams, but when in life will you ever have to remember lots of information about lots of texts, then be expected to recall it perfectly under pressured conditions, on top of loads of other stresses, then write about it for strangers to judge whether or not you are worthy of a good grade or not.

attributes.action: Introduce a maximum wage as a factor of the lowest paid employee's wage.
attributes.background: Wage gaps have got out of hand, meaning top earners are paid a ridiculous amount more then entry level staff. Often on a false pretense that hugh salaries attract the best candidates.  It just attracts the greedy.More people are struggling to make ends meet due to inflation driven by a skewed.
attributes.additional_details: impression of growth The average salary is distorted by excessively high wages while most people barely get by. This has driven up day to day living costs while every day workers buying power has decreased. A cap on how many times the lowest salary a company's top salary is would drive up that bottom salary and make wage distribution fairer, would equalise the housing market and boast the economy much more than 99% of money being in the hands of 1% of people.

attributes.action: Age restrictions for buying corrosive products like bleach and drain cleaner
attributes.background: More than 96 people have been a victim of acid attacks in London alone this year. It’s too easy to purchase the products for making acid. There are currently no age restrictions. When paying for corrosives, it should be made necessary to pay by card which is then traceable.

attributes.action: Carbon monoxide detectors in student accommodation and lettings
attributes.background:
My daughter has just moved into a student flat were we found no carbon monoxide detectors, which I thought would be a legal requirement. But after speaking to the letting company they told me that they there's no legal requirement for them.
We all know the consequences of a carbon monoxide leak...
attributes.additional_details:
This is what I received from Save the Student when I put the question to them regarding the law...
They are only legally required for any room containing a solid fuel burning appliance, and not for Gas appliances. However gas boilers can emit carbon monoxide, and the government say "we would expect and encourage reputable landlords to ensure that working carbon monoxide alarms are installed in rooms with gas boilers". So we advise you put strong pressure on the agent to do the right thing.

attributes.action: Fund free rail travel to school for children
attributes.background:
Kids travel free on buses and trams, but pay for rail.
Children should be encouraged to go by rail.
Roads would be less congested. Rail is safer.
They would be more likely to use rail when they grow up.
The UK Government should therefore fund free rail travel for school children.

attributes.action: Emotional Assistance Pet Act Urgently Needed
attributes.background: To grant the right for people in rented accommodation who are struggling with emotional distress, depression – to keep a pet regardless of any “No Pet Clause”.
attributes.additional_details: Please visit: http://eap-uk.org/

attributes.action: make the punishment for stealing tools from tradesmens vehicles harsher.
attributes.background: There seems to be a marked increase in thefts of tools from trade vehicles. Most of the people affected are self employed so the actual cost to them cannot be quantified. They lose work have to spend money replacing thousands of pounds of tools often accumulated over many years.
